text.p: Kimberly-Clark Corp said on Tuesday tissue prices would have an $200 million annualized negative impact on 1996 results and that it was hesitant to forecast 1997 North American tissue prices.
Chief Financial Officer Jack Donehower told a conference call that it would take a major move of between $150 and $200 per ton in pulp prices to affect tissue prices.
"I'm hesitant to forecast 1997 tissue prices," Donehower said. He said prices could firm slightly outside North American, particularly in some parts of Asia, which had deep price discounts.

In the third quarter 1996, the company said it achieved strong results despite a decrease earlier in the year in U.S. consumer and international tissue prices. Kimberly-Clark also said sales of its key U.S. bathroom tissue and paper towel products increased in each quarter of 1996.
